text: Hugo Scheltema (11 June 1918 – 1 September 1996) was a Dutch diplomat. He served as Permanent Representative to the United Nations in New York, as Chairman of the United Nations Economic and Social Council in 1979Former Presidents, 1946–2004, United Nations Economic and Social Council and as Chairman of UNICEF from 1982 to 1983.Officers of the UNICEF Executive Board 1946–2014, UNICEFExecutive Board, UNICEF He was also Ambassador to Iraq, Indonesia and Belgium earlier in his career. He was a son of the tobacco merchant Hugo Scheltema (1890–1939).Nederland's Patriciaat 27 (1941), p. 242. He studied law and joined the diplomatic service in 1945, and was posted to China for several years.CS Scheltema-Hellingman, Correspondentie Hugo Scheltema tijdens zijn verblijf in China 1946–1947. The Hague, 2010. ==References== Category:Ambassadors of the Netherlands to Iraq Category:Chairmen and Presidents of UNICEF Category:1918 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Dutch lawyers Category:Ambassadors of the Netherlands to Indonesia Category:Ambassadors of the Netherlands to Belgium Category:Permanent Representatives of the Netherlands to the United Nations Category:Dutch officials of the United Nations Category:20th-century lawyers
title: Hugo Scheltema
